alert.note: Alert for Southern Fairfield (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued June 03 at 4:55AM EDT until June 04 at 1:00AM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 1 AM EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Up to one foot of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. * WHERE...In Connecticut, Southern Fairfield County. In New York, Southern Westchester County. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 1 AM EDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding is expected in the more vulnerable locations near the waterfront and shoreline.Some roads and low lying properties including parking lots, parks,lawns, and homes and businesses with basements near the waterfront will experience minor flooding. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. STAMFORD HARBOR AT STAMFORD CT MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 9.3 FT, MODERATE 10.9 FT, MAJOR 12.3 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.5 FT, MODERATE 3.1 FT, MAJOR 4.5 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 03/11 AM 8.6/ 9.1 0.8/ 1.3 1.2/ 1.7 1-2 NONE 04/12 AM 9.6/10.1 1.8/ 2.2 0.9/ 1.4 2-3 MINOR 04/12 PM 8.4/ 8.9 0.6/ 1.1 0.9/ 1.4 2 NONE 05/12 AM 9.7/10.2 1.9/ 2.3 0.9/ 1.4 1-2 MINOR BRIDGEPORT HARBOR AT BRIDGEPORT CT MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 8.9 FT, MODERATE 10.4 FT, MAJOR 11.4 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.6 FT, MODERATE 3.1 FT, MAJOR 4.1 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 03/11 AM 7.8/ 8.4 0.6/ 1.1 1.2/ 1.7 1 NONE 04/12 AM 9.0/ 9.5 1.7/ 2.2 1.1/ 1.6 1 MINOR 04/12 PM 7.8/ 8.4 0.6/ 1.1 1.1/ 1.6 0 NONE 05/12 AM 8.9/ 9.4 1.6/ 2.0 1.0/ 1.5 0 MINOR LITTLE NECK BAY AT KINGS POINT NY MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 10.0 FT, MODERATE 10.5 FT, MAJOR 13.0 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 2.2 FT, MODERATE 2.7 FT, MAJOR 5.2 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 03/11 AM 8.6/ 9.1 0.8/ 1.3 1.3/ 1.8 1 NONE 03/11 PM 9.7/10.2 2.0/ 2.5 1.2/ 1.7 1 MINOR 04/12 PM 8.5/ 9.0 0.7/ 1.1 1.0/ 1.5 1 NONE 05/12 AM 9.7/10.2 1.9/ 2.3 0.9/ 1.4 1 NONE &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
